parse.title: The Hobbit-forming World of J.R.R. Tolkien

links.*: The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide

wikitext.*:
'''''The Hobbit-forming World of J.R.R. Tolkien''''' refers to the title of an article which includes extracts from an interview with [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]. The interview was conducted by Henry Resnik over the telephone, for the magazine the ''Saturday Evening Post'' (published in [[Saturday Evening Post (2 July 1966)|the issue of 2 July 1966]]). The interview was perhaps conducted on [[2 March]] [[1966]] and according to Resnik they spoke for about half an hour. According to [[Clyde S. Kilby]], Tolkien disliked the published article and had hung up on Resnik.<ref>{{CG|C}}, p. 657</ref> Kilby also explains that Tolkien denied to have said some affirmations about [[Middle-earth]] being Europe, although these do not seem to be false per se.<ref>[[Clyde S. Kilby]], ''[[Tolkien and The Silmarillion]]'', "Chronology of Composition", p. 51</ref>

A more complete transcription of the interview was published in [[Niekas 18|''Niekas'' Issue 18 (Late Spring 1967)]].<ref>{{webcite|author=An Illustrated Tolkien Bibliography|articleurl=http://www.tolkienbooks.net/php/details2.php?id=565|articlename=Saturday Evening Post
|dated=|website=TB|accessed=18 August 2020}}</ref> The issue is readable [http://efanzines.com/Niekas/Niekas-18.pdf#37 online].
